metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26373 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Non-transparent sharing of return predictor targets between contexts in some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. Pawan Kumar Gupta, Alyssa Milburn, Amit Peled, Shani Rehana, Nir Shildan and Ariel Sabba discovered that some Intel processors with Enhanced Indirect Branch Restricted Speculation (eIBRS) did not properly handle RET instructions after a VM exits. A local attacker could potentially use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-204-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-aws - 4.15.0-1150.163
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> USN-5975-1 first publication included esm/xenial linux-gcp version 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1 by mistake, please refer to USN-6007-1.

criterions.comment: buffer package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.163').
